title: Fatality numbers from heat waves and cold waves in the U.S.from 1900 to 2016
summary: This chart shows the Number of fatalities conducted by from in a heat waves .
\\n From the chart we see that the Heat_wave_1995_Missouri_Oklahoma_Illinois Type, was the Fatality numbers Type, in the waves with 1260 fatalities .

The next Type, to make the most fatalities was the Heat_wave_1999_Illinois_Missouri_Wisconsin Type, with 257 fatalities closely followed by Heat_wave_2012_Washington_DC_Iowa_Virginia_North_Carolina with 107 fatalities .

Heat wave 2012 Washington DC Iowa Virginia North Carolina

gold: This statistic shows a list of heat waves and cold waves experienced in the United States from 1900 to 2016 , by the number of fatalities that occurred as a result . In the deadliest event on record , around 1,260 people lost their lives as a result of a heat wave in 1980 in Missouri and Tennessee .
